comments: a(0) cannot be defined because 0's divisors are an infinite set (every number is a divisor of 0.)
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500 (using data from A001265)
example: a(120) = 73728 since 2^120-1 has that many divisors.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = numdiv(2^n-1); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 15 2013(MAGMA) [DivisorSigma(0, 2^n - 1): n in [1..100]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 27 2015
author: _Labos Elemer_
extensions: Typo in example fixed by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 15 2010
